column1: Pacific Grove is a coastal city in Monterey County
column2: California in the United States.  The 2010 United States Census population is 15
column3: 041. Pacific Grove is located between Point Pinos and Monterey.Pacific Grove has numerous Victorian-era houses
column4: some of which have been turned into bed and breakfast inns. The city is also the location of the Point Pinos Lighthouse
column5: the Pacific Grove Museum of Natural History and the Pacific Grove Art Center. Author John Steinbeck resided in Pacific Grove for a number of years. Later
column6: the area was a filming location for A Summer Place starring Sandra Dee
column7: for Roger Spottiswoode's 1989 film Turner & Hooch
column8: and for the TV series Big Little Lies.

column1: Pacific Grove was founded in 1875 when the Pacific Land Improvement Company
column3: donated acreage towards the first West Coast Chautauqua retreat formed by a group of Methodists who modeled the town after Ocean Grove
column4: New Jersey. In time
column6: fragrant pines and fresh sea air brought others to the Pacific Grove Retreat to rest and meditate. The initial camp meeting of the Pacific Coast branch of the Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle was held in Pacific Grove in June 1879. Modeled after the Methodist Sunday school teachers' training camp established in 1874 at Chautauqua Lake
column8: this location became part of a nationwide educational network.

column2: after the summer campers returned home
column3: Robert Louis Stevenson wandered into the deserted campgrounds: "I have never been in any place so dreamlike. Indeed
column4: it was not so much like a deserted town as like a scene upon the stage by daylight
column5: and with no one on the boards."

column1: The Pacific Grove post office opened in 1886
column3: and was re-opened in 1887. Pacific Grove incorporated in 1889.Pacific Grove
column4: like Carmel-by-the-Sea and Monterey
column5: became an artists' haven in the 1890s and subsequent period. Artists of the En plein air school in both Europe and the United States were seeking an outdoor venue which had natural beauty
column6: so that Pacific Grove was a magnet for this movement. William Adam was an English painter who first moved to Monterey and then decided on Pacific Grove for his home in 1906. At about the same time Eugen Neuhaus
column8: arrived in Pacific Grove with his new bride. Charles B. Judson was an artist of aristocratic lineage who painted in Pacific Grove over a long period of time beginning in 1907; Judson's murals decorate the halls of the California Academy of Sciences.

column1: The Asilomar Conference Grounds are located at the western edge of Pacific Grove. Asilomar opened in 1913 as a YWCA summer retreat it now belongs to the California State Park System. Thirteen buildings on these grounds were designed by the architect Julia Morgan

column2: John Steinbeck lived in a cottage in Pacific Grove owned by his father
column3: Ernest
column4: who was Monterey County treasurer. The cottage still stands on a quiet side street at 147 11th St.
column5: without any plaque or special sign
column6: virtually overlooked by most Steinbeck fans. Another Steinbeck related house is at 222 Central Ave
column7: which was his grandmother's house. A golden statue of Steinbeck in the front yard stood for years before it was removed. In Steinbeck's book Sweet Thursday
column8: a chapter is dedicated to describing a (probably fictional) rivalry that arose among the town's residents over the game of roque.

column1: Local traditions include a Butterfly Parade held in early October to celebrate the return of the monarch butterfly to its wintering habitat. Also held in July is the Feast of Lanterns
column2: a unique faux Chinese festival whose origin is rooted in the traditional Chautauqua closing ceremonies from the late 1800s. Feast of Lanterns is a weeklong festival with opening ceremonies held at Chautauqua Hall
column3: a pet parade and a Chinese style pageant with fireworks at Lover's Point Beach on the last Saturday in July. Mid April a Good Old Days festival is held downtown which includes rides
column4: crafts booths

column2: maintains a campus next to the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Hopkins Marine Station was founded in 1892
column3: making it the oldest marine laboratory on the US Pacific Coast
column4: and the second-oldest in the US
column5: after the Marine Biological Laboratory in Woods Hole
column6: Massachusetts. It was originally named the Hopkins Seaside Laboratory and located on what is now Lover's Point.

column2: Pacific Grove was the site of the pioneering microcomputer software company Digital Research. Originally located in Gary Kildall's house on the corner of Lighthouse and Willow it later moved to offices on Central Ave.

column3: John Denver died when he crashed into the Pacific Ocean off Pacific Grove in his personal plane.Pacific Grove was the last dry town in California. Due to its religious and gated history alcohol was not served to the public until July 4
column5: at the grand opening of the Pacific Grove Art Center by ElMarie Dyke
column6: its founder. This caused much controversy because the law wasn't to take effect until November of that year. Ironically
column7: ElMarie was also a great proponent for keeping the town dry. To this day Pacific Grove has very strict laws regarding the service of alcohol and there are no stand-alone bars. (Alton Pryor

column2: 2018 general municipal election Pacific Grove voters approved Measure M
column3: which prohibits short-term vacation rentals in residential districts outside the Coastal Zone.

column1: Pacific Grove contains several habitat types including marine
column3: pine forest and mixed oak woodland. The famed breeding habitat for the monarch butterfly is situated in the northwest part of town imbedded in residential neighborhoods in mixed oak forests. These monarchs migrate 2
column4: 000 miles (3
column5: 200 km) to reach Pacific Grove after their summer in the Rocky Mountains

column1: The black-and-orange monarch butterflies spend much of the fall and winter in Monterey pine and eucalyptus trees
column2: roughly from the vernal equinox through the spring equinox. The majority of butterflies are protected in the city's Butterfly Sanctuary. City Ordinance No. 352 makes it a misdemeanor to kill or threaten a butterfly
column3: punishable by a $1000 fine.

column1: Pacific Grove Marine Gardens State Marine Conservation Area
column3: Edward F. Ricketts State Marine Conservation Area and Asilomar State Marine Reserve are marine protected areas in the waters around Pacific Grove. Like underwater parks
column4: these marine protected areas help conserve ocean wildlife and marine ecosystems. Monterey Bay is a marine protected sanctuary.

column1: The principal noise source in Pacific Grove is State Route 68. There are approximately 800 residents exposed to sound levels of 60 CNEL or above
column2: making Pacific Grove noticeably quieter than its neighbor Monterey
column3: which has more tourist traffic and more through traffic.The town sits between its two well known neighbors
column4: Pebble Beach and Monterey. Carmel-by-the-Sea is the next city
column6: and the community of Big Sur is 30 miles south. Pacific Grove is a favorite vacation getaway for San Francisco Bay Area residents
column7: located one and a half hours south of San Francisco.

column1: The town does not allow development on the waterside of the ocean-front street
column2: so that the beaches and scenic points are unobstructed.
-121.921025). That places it on the Pacific Ocean between Monterey and Pebble Beach
column3: about 40 miles south of Santa Cruz and about 100 miles south of San Francisco. According to the United States Census Bureau
column4: the city has a total area of 4.0 square miles (10 km2). 2.9 square miles (7.5 km2) of it is land and 1.1 square miles (2.8 km2) of it (28.42%) is water. Asilomar
column5: Lovers Point and the intervening coastline afford surfing
column6: which is challenging due to near shore rocks
column7: albeit waves are typically moderate in height.

column1: Pacific Grove's climate is mild throughout the year
column2: essentially the same as in neighboring Monterey
column3: with most of the rain falling from November through April. Extreme temperatures are rare and fog is common
column4: especially in the late night and early morning
column5: all year. (See Monterey for more details.)

column1: This region experiences warm (but not hot) and dry summers
column2: with no average monthly temperatures above 71.6 °F. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system
column3: Pacific Grove has a warm-summer Mediterranean climate
column4: abbreviated "Csb" on climate maps.

column1: Pacific Grove is governed by city council consisting of a mayor and six councilmembers
column2: all elected at-large. As of the November 2018 election the mayor is Bill Peake
column3: and Robert Huitt serves as mayor pro tempore. The remaining councilmembers are Jenny McAdams
column4: Amy Tomlinson
column7: and Nick Smith.At the county level
column8: Pacific Grove is represented on the Monterey County Board of Supervisors by Mary Adams.In the California State Assembly
column9: Pacific Grove is represented by Mark Stone as part of the 29th Assembly district. In the California State Senate
column10: it is represented by Bill Monning as part of the 17th Senate district.In the United States House of Representatives
column11: Pacific Grove is in California's  20th congressional district
